sentence: Consumer products maker The Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) on Monday caught a big downgrade from analysts at Stifel Nicolaus.
The firm said it cut its rating on PG from "Buy" to "Hold" but maintained its price target of $70.
That target suggests a 5.7% upside to the stock's Friday closing price of $66.23.
Stifel Nicolaus noted the move was a valuation call.
Shares of Procter & Gamble ( PG ) have a 3.17% dividend yield, based on Friday's closing stock price of $66.23.
The stock has technical support in the $62-$64 price area.
If the shares can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the $68-$70 price level.
The Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) is not recommended at this time, holding a Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Rating of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
